response:
The presentation of multifocal deficits (optic nerve and cerebral hemisphere) disseminated in space, occurring subacutely in a 47-year-old male, is highly suggestive of an inflammatory demyelinating etiology. While vascular causes are possible, the progressive 11-day history and multifocal specific pattern favor inflammation.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "MOG Antibody Disease (MOG-AD)", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)", "Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis (ADEM)"]
